Hiei and the Mori clan go back to the death of the first ancestor of the Mori clan, Shichiro Yoshitaka MUTSU, who had been killed by an arrow shot by one of the warrior monks of Mt. Hiei, leading some to see the burning of the temples on Mt. Hiei as karmic retribution for Yoshinari's death.

sen.j: 比叡山とは積年の因縁で結びついていたといえよう。
sen.e: It can be said that Yoshinari and Mt. Hiei were connected by the history of long standing.
It can be said that Yoshinari and Mt. Hiei were connected through this long standing history.
Given their long-standing association, it is fair to say that Yoshinari had a significant connection to Mt. Hiei.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 戦で指が一本欠けており手足の指が合わせて19本であったため「十九」という蔑称で呼ばれる事もあったという。
sen.e: Yoshinari lost one of his fingers during the war and had 19 fingers/toes in total: he was sometimes called "Juku" (nineteen) by a derogatory name.
sen.cmt: 欠けている一本の「指」は手足いずれの指かが不明でしたが、ここでは手の指と訳しました。
sen.e: Yoshinari lost one of his fingers during the war and had 19 fingers/toes in total: he was sometimes referred to by the derogatory name "Juku" (nineteen).
Yoshinari had lost one of his fingers during battle and thus had a total of only 19 fingers and toes; as a result, it is said he was sometimes mocked with the epithet "Juku" (Nineteen).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 比叡山延暦寺焼き討ちの際に寺院や坂本の町は悉く焼き払われ、僧も虐殺されたが可成の墓所の有る聖衆来迎寺だけは手出しをされなかった。
sen.e: In the attack and burn of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei, temples and the town of Sakamoto were all burned away and priests were slaughtered; however, only Shoju-raigo-ji Temple having the grave of Yoshinari was kept off.

In the attack and burning of Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei, the temples and town of Sakamoto were all burned and priests slaughtered; and only Shoju-raigo-ji Temple, which housed the grave of Yoshinari was spared.

During the attack on (and burning of) Enryaku-ji Temple on Mt. Hiei, all its subtemples and the entire town of Sakamoto were burned down and its priests slaughtered; only Shoju-raigo-ji Temple, which housed the grave of Yoshinari, was spared this fate.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 天文_(元号)23年（1554年）5月、前年、織田信長の主筋であった尾張守護代・織田信友が尾張守護・斯波義統を殺害したため、信友を謀反人として清洲城に攻める。
sen.e: In May 1554, as a relative of Nobunaga ODA, Nobutomo ODA, Owari no kuni shugodai (provincial governor of Owari Province), killed Yoshimune SHIBA, the guard of Owari, Yoshinari attacked Nobutomo in Kiyosu Castle as a rebel.

In May 1554, as a relative of Nobunaga ODA, Nobutomo ODA, Owari no kuni shugodai (provincial governor of Owari Province), killed Yoshimune SHIBA, the guard of Owari, Yoshinari attacked Nobutomo in Kiyosu Castle as a rebel.

In June 1554, Nobutomo ODA, the deputy governor of Owari province and a close relative of Nobunaga ODA, murdered Yoshimune SHIBA, the governor of Owari, which led to Yoshinari assaulting Nobutomo as a rebel at Kiyosu-jo Castle
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 可成、この戦いにおいて敵将・織田信友を討ち取り、首級を挙げる。
sen.e: In this battle, Yoshinari defeated and decapitated the leader of the enemy forces Nobutomo ODA.
In this battle, Yoshinari defeated and decapitated the leader of the enemy forces Nobutomo ODA.
During this battle, Yoshinari defeated the rebel leader, Nobutomo ODA, and decapitated him.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 弘治 (日本)2年（1556年）
4月、斎藤道三、義龍親子の内紛において、退却中に斎藤方の千石又一と激しく渡り合い、無事織田軍を退却に導く。
sen.e: In April in the infighting between Dosan SAITO and Yoshitatsu, the parent and child, Yoshinari clashed with Mataichi SENGOKU on the Saito side while evacuating, leading the Oda forces to securely evacuate.
In April during infighting between Dosan SAITO and Yoshitatsu, the parent and child, Yoshinari clashed with Mataichi SENGOKU on the Saito side while evacuating, leading the Oda forces safety.

In May, during the internecine strife between Dosan SAITO and his son Toshitatsu, Yoshinari and Mataichi SENGOKU of the Saito faction fought a fierce battle while the Oda forces were withdrawing, and managed to ensure the Oda army's evacuation in safety.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 8月、織田家家老 林秀貞、柴田勝家らが織田信行を奉じて信長に反旗、稲生の戦いで林隊に斬り込み獅子奮迅の活躍。
sen.e: In August, Hidesada HAYASHI and Katsuie SHIBATA, Karo (chief retainer) of Oda clan, and others served Nobuyuki ODA to rebel against Nobunaga; Yoshinari struck down the Hayashi's forces in the Battle of Inou, working like crazy.

In August, Hidesada HAYASHI and Katsuie SHIBATA, Karo (chief retainer) of Oda clan, and others served Nobuyuki ODA to rebel against Nobunaga; Yoshinari struck down Hayashi's forces in the Battle of Inou.

In September, Hidesada HAYASHI and Katsuie SHIBATA, both senior retainers of the Oda clan, and others rebelled against Nobunaga and switched their allegiance to Nobuyuki ODA; during the Battle of Inou, Yoshinari was very active, leading a furious assault on Hayashi's forces.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 永禄元年（1558年）7月、尾張上4郡守護代で岩倉城主・織田信安と対峙、浮野の戦いにおいて先陣を務める。
sen.e: In July 1558, he held out against Nobuyasu ODA, the load of four upper districts of Owari and the lord of Iwakura Castle, serving as a spearhead in the Battle of Ukino.
In July 1558, he held out against Nobuyasu ODA, the lord of four upper districts of Owari and the lord of Iwakura Castle, spearheading the Battle of Ukino.

In August 1558, he held out against the assault of Nobuyasu ODA, the deputy governor of four upper districts of Iwari and lord of Iwakura-jo Castle, and in the Battle of Ukino he led the vanguard of Nobunaga's army.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 劣勢であったが、死闘の末、可成ら信長方奮戦により勝利を導く。
sen.e: Although Yoshinari's forces were outnumbered, Yoshinari led the Nobunaga forces to the victory as a result of the desperate battle and fight.
Although Yoshinari's forces were outnumbered, Yoshinari led the Nobunaga forces to victory despite the desperate battle and fight.
Despite being outnumbered, Yoshinari and Nobunaga's other commanders led their forces through a hard-fought battle to victory.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 永禄3年（1560年）5月、桶狭間の戦いで今川方の田宮左近を討ち取る。
sen.e: In May 1560, he defeated Sakon TAMIYA of the Imagawa clan in the Battle of Okehazama.
In May 1560, he defeated Sakon TAMIYA of the Imagawa clan in the Battle of Okehazama.
In June 1560, he defeated Sakon TAMIYA, an ally of the Imagawa clan, in the Battle of Okehazama.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 同戦いにて、織田から今川に転じた山口教継、戸部新左衛門の名を語らい、両名が織田に内通していると流言飛語の策を弄し、両名が今川義元の手討ちとなり、敵方切り崩しに成功。
sen.e: In the battle, he disclosed the names of Noritsugu YAMAGUCHI and Shinzaemon TOBE who left the Oda clan to support the Imagawa clan, circulating a false rumor that they held secret communication with the Oda clan; as a result, they were killed by Yoshimoto IMAGAWA with his sword, leading Yoshinari to successfully undermine the enemy.

In the battle, he disclosed the names of Noritsugu YAMAGUCHI and Shinzaemon TOBE who left the Oda clan to support the Imagawa clan, circulating a false rumor that they had held secret communiques with the Oda clan; as a result, they were killed by Yoshimoto IMAGAWA's sword, leading Yoshinari to successfully undermine the enemy.

During the battle, he spread a false rumor that named Noritsugu YAMAGUCHI and Shizaemon TOBE, who had switched their allegiance from the Oda to the Imagawa clan, as double agents still secretly communicating with the Oda forces; Yoshimoto IMAGAWA executed them, bringing success to Yoshinari's strategy of driving a wedge of distrust through the enemy forces.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: また可成はこの戦で四宮某を討ち取る。
sen.e: In this battle, Yoshinari also killed Sakon SHINOMIYA.
sen.cmt: 「四宮某」はウェブで確認すると「四宮左近」となっていましたので、「四宮左近」と訳しました。
sen.e: In this battle, Yoshinari also killed Sakon SHINOMIYA.
It was during this same battle that Yoshinari struck down Sakon SHINOMIYA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 永禄7年（1564年）夏、織田軍、美濃に攻め入り、長井道利の堂洞城を攻め、陥落。
sen.e: In the summer of 1564, the Oda forces invaded Mino, attacking Michitoshi NAGAI in Donohora Castle, resulting in the fall of the Donohora Castle.
In the summer of 1564, the Oda forces invaded Mino, attacking Michitoshi NAGAI in Donohora Castle, resulting in the fall of the Donohora Castle.
In the summer of 1564, the Oda army invaded Mino province, attacking Michitoshi NAGAI's Donohora-jo Castle and driving the castle to surrender.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 斎藤龍興・長井道利の追撃を破った。
sen.e: The Oda forces eluded the pursuit of Tatsuoki SAITO and Michitoshi NAGAI.
The Oda forces eluded the pursuit of Tatsuoki SAITO and Michitoshi NAGAI.
The Oda forces eluded the pursuit of Tatsuoki SAITO and Michitoshi NAGAI.

sen.j: 恩賞として美濃国烏峰城主に封じられる（改築の上、金山城 (美濃国)に改名）。
sen.e: Yoshinari was awarded with Uho Castle in Mino Province to be the lord of the castle (it was renamed Kaneyama Castle (Mino Province) after reconstruction).
Yoshinari was awarded with Uho Castle in Mino Province becoming lord of the castle (it was renamed Kaneyama Castle (Mino Province) after reconstruction).
As a reward for his service, Yoshinari was made lord of Uho-jo Castle (which was renamed Kaneyama-jo Castle (in Mino province) after it was restored).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 永禄10年（1567年）、可成によって、かねて内応を打診していた西美濃三人衆、安藤守就、稲葉一鉄、氏家卜全が織田家に転じる。
sen.e: In 1567, Nishi Mino Sannin-shu (three elite retainers of West Mino), Morinari ANDO, Ittetsu INABA, and Bokuzen UJIIE, turned to support the Oda family in response to the Yoshinari's previous attempt to hold secret communication.

In 1567, Nishi Mino Sannin-shu (three elite retainers of West Mino), Morinari ANDO, Ittetsu INABA, and Bokuzen UJIIE, turned to support the Oda family in response to the Yoshinari's previous attempt to hold secret talks.

In 1567, after holding secret negotiations with the Nishi Mino Sannin-shu (the Three Elite Retainers of west Mino), namely Morinari ANDO, Ittetsu INABA, and Bokuzen UJIIE, Yoshinari succeeded in convincing them to switch their allegiance to the Oda family.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 永禄11年（1568年）、足利一門・足利義栄を旗頭とする三好三人衆の謀叛に倒れた室町幕府の第13代将軍・足利義輝の弟・足利義昭が信長を頼って美濃国を訪れてきた為、織田家は義昭を新将軍に推戴するため、義昭を奉じ上洛の途につく。
sen.e: In 1568, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the brother of Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA, the 13th seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) which was brought down by the rebellion by miyoshi sanninshu (three chief retainers of the Miyoshi clan) headed by Yoshihide ASHIKAGA of Ashikaga clan, relied on Nobunaga to visit him in Mino Province; Accordingly, the Oda family supported him and visited Kyoto to have Yoshiaki as a new shogun.

In 1568, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the brother of Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA, the 13th seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) which was brought down by the rebellion by miyoshi sanninshu (three chief retainers of the Miyoshi clan) headed by Yoshihide ASHIKAGA of Ashikaga clan, relied on Nobunaga to visit him in Mino Province; Accordingly, the Oda family supported him and visited Kyoto to set Yoshiaki as the new shogun.

In 1568, Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, the younger brother of the 13th Muromachi Shogun Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA--who had been toppled in a rebellion by the Miyoshi sanninshu (the Three Chief Retainers of the Miyoshi clan) that had been led by Yoshihide ASHIKAGA of Ashikaga clan--begged Nobunaga to come visit him in Mino Province; consequently, the Oda family threw their support behind him and marched on Kyoto to install Yoshiaki as the new shogun.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 9月11日、織田勢は義昭方への協力を拒否した六角氏の拠点、近江国箕作城を攻める（観音寺城の戦い）。
sen.e: On September 11, the Oda forces attacked Mitsukuri-jo Castle in Omi Province in which Rokkaku clan was based, because the Rokkaku clan rejected to cooperate with Yoshiaki (Battle of Kannonji Castle).

On September 11, the Oda forces attacked Mitsukuri-jo Castle in Omi Province, where the Rokkaku clan was based, because of the Rokkaku clan rejection to cooperate with Yoshiaki (Battle of Kannonji Castle).

On October 11, the Oda forces (in what is known as the Battle of Kannonji-jo Castle) attacked the stronghold of the Rokkaku clan, namely Mitsukuri-jo Castle in Omi province, after the Rokkaku clan refused to join forces with Yoshiaki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しましたOn the eleventh day of the ninth month,→On October 11,(グレゴリオ歴に変更）

sen.j: 可成は竹邊源八等とともに先陣を務め、六角氏を下して9月26日に上洛を果たす。
sen.e: Yoshinari served as a spearhead of the forces with Genpachi TAKEBE and defeated the Rokkaku clan to reach Kyoto on September 26.
Yoshinari spearheaded the forces with Genpachi TAKEBE and defeated the Rokkaku clan reaching Kyoto on September 26.
Yoshinari and Genpachi TAKEBE led Nobunaga's vanguard and defeated the Rokkaku clan, completing their march on Kyoto on October 26.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しましたon the 26th day of the ninth month→on October 26(グレゴリオ歴に変更）

sen.j: 上洛後すぐに足利義栄を奉じる三好方の山城国勝龍寺城を攻め、城主・岩成友通を降参せしむ。
sen.e: Soon after visiting Kyoto, he attacked Shoryuji Castle in Yamashiro Province of Miyoshi who served Yoshihide ASHIKAGA, and made Tomomichi IWANARI, the lord of the castle, surrender.
Soon after visiting Kyoto, he attacked Shoryuji Castle in Yamashiro Province of Miyoshi who served Yoshihide ASHIKAGA, and made Tomomichi IWANARI, the lord of the castle, surrender.

Soon after arriving in Kyoto, Yoshinari attacked Shoryuji-jo Castle--allied with the Miyoshi faction that continued to serve Yoshihide ASHIKAGA--in Yamashiro province, forcing Tomomichi IWANARI, lord of the castle, to surrender.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: また摂津国芥川城・小清水城・池田城等の諸城も落とす。
sen.e: He also took control of Akutagawa Castle, Koshimizu Castle, and Ikeda Castle in Settsu Province.
He also took control of Akutagawa Castle, Koshimizu Castle, and Ikeda Castle in Settsu Province.
He also took control of Akutagawa-jo Castle, Koshimizu-jo Castle, and Ikeda-jo Castle in Settsu Province.

sen.j: 元亀元年（1570年）
4月25日、政権運営を巡りかねて信長と対立を深めた足利義昭に呼応して信長包囲網を形成した朝倉氏を攻めるため、朝倉の支配する越前国天筒山城を攻めに加わる。
sen.e: On April 25, in order to attack the Asakura clan who colluded with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA having serious confrontation with Nobunaga over handling of the government and formed an encircling net against Nobunaga, Yoshinari attacked Tezutsuyama Castle in Echizen Province controlled by Asakura.

On April 25, in order to attack the Asakura clan, which had colluded with Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, who had conflicts with Nobunaga over the handling of the government, Yoshinari encircled Nobunaga, and attacked Tezutsuyama Castle in Echizen Province controlled by Asakura.

On June 8, Yoshinari joined the assault on Tezutsuyama-jo Castle in Echizen province, which was controlled by the Asakura clan, who had been trying to encircle Nobunaga in response to a request by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, who himself had experienced a deep rift with Nobunaga over his handling of the government.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 翌日、陥落。
sen.e: The castle fell the next day.
The castle fell the next day.
The castle surrendered the following day.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 越前国金ヶ崎城、疋田城を落とす。
sen.e: Yoshinari took control of Kanegasaki Castle and Hikita Castle in Echizen Province.
Yoshinari took control of Kanegasaki Castle and Hikita Castle in Echizen Province.
Yoshinari took control of Kanegasaki-jo Castle and Hikita-jo Castle in Echizen Province.

sen.j: その後、信長妹婿 浅井長政信長に離反し敵対の姿勢を見せる。
sen.e: After that, Nagamasa ASAI, Nobunaga's sister's husband, turned against Nobunaga and betrayed.
Following this, Nagamasa ASAI, Nobunaga's sister's husband, turned against Nobunaga, betraying him.
Thereafter, Nagamasa ASAI, Nobunaga's brother-in-law, betrayed Nobunaga and began moving against him.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 織田軍撤退を余儀なくされ、可成は朽木谷の朽木元綱に対し織田家主従の京都帰還への協力を依頼する。
sen.e: The Oda forces were forced to withdraw; Yoshinari requested Mototsuna KUTSUKI in Kutsukidani to cooperate with the members of the Oda family in returning to Kyoto.
The Oda forces were forced to withdraw; while Yoshinari requested Mototsuna KUTSUKI in Kutsukidani to cooperate with the members of the Oda family in returning to Kyoto.
The Oda army was forced to withdraw, while in the meantime, Yoshinari asked Mototsuna KUTSUKI of Kutsukidani to lend his strength to the Oda family's forces in their planned return to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 6月26日、姉川の合戦。
sen.e: June 26: Battle of Anegawa.
June 26: Battle of Anegawa.
August 7: Battle of Anegawa.

sen.j: 織田・徳川連合軍と浅井・朝倉連合軍衝突。
sen.e: The allied forces of Oda and Tokunaga battled against the allied forces of Asai and Asakura.
The allied forces of Oda and Tokunaga battled against the allied forces of Asai and Asakura.
The allied forces of Oda and Tokugawa battled against the allied forces of Asai and Asakura.

sen.j: 可成は第五陣に附属し出陣。
sen.e: Yoshinari fought in the fifth troop.
Yoshinari fought in the fifth regimen.
Yoshinari marched out to battle affiliated with Nobunaga's Fifth Army.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 9月、石山本願寺蜂起（野田城・福島城の戦い）。
sen.e: In September, the uprising of Ishiyama Honganji Temple (Battles of Noda Castle and Fukushima Castle) occurred.
The uprising of Ishiyama Honganji Temple (Battles of Noda Castle and Fukushima Castle) occurred in September.
The uprising of Ishiyama Honganji Temple (Battles of Noda-jo Castle and Fukushima-jo Castle) occurred in October.
sen.cmt: グレゴリ歴に修正in October and November.→in October.

sen.j: 織田軍鎮圧の途につくも、背後から浅井・朝倉連合軍が挙兵。
sen.e: The Oda forces tried to suppress the uprising; the allied forces of Asai and Aasakura raised the army from the back of the Oda forces.
The Oda forces tried to suppress the uprising; the allied forces of Asai and Aasakura raised an army behind the Oda forces.
While the Oda forces tried to suppress the uprising, the combined forces of the Asai and Asakura clans began raising an army to Nobunaga's rear.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: 宇佐山城守備を命ぜられ奮戦。
sen.e: Yoshinari was ordered to protect Usayama Castle.
Yoshinari was ordered to protect Usayama Castle.
Yoshinari was ordered to protect Usayama-jo Castle.

sen.j: 9月16日の緒戦において勝利し、9月20日の戦では朝倉景鏡隊を追い返し、同じく朝倉方山崎吉家隊、阿波賀小三郎隊、浅井方の浅井玄蕃允隊、浅井長政旗本らと交戦。
sen.e: On September 16, he won the battle in the beginning, and in the battle of September 20, he defeated the forces of Kageakira ASAKURA and similarly battled against the Asakura forces, including the forces of Yoshiie YAMAZAKI, Kosaburo AHAKA and the Asai forces, the forces of Genba ASAI and Nagamasa ASAI hatamoto (a direct vassal of the shogun).

On September 16, he won the initial battle, and on September 20, he defeated the forces of Kageakira ASAKURA in a battle, and similarly fought the Asakura forces, including the forces of Yoshiie YAMAZAKI, Kosaburo AHAKA and the Asai forces, the forces of Genba ASAI and Nagamasa ASAI hatamoto (a direct vassal of the shogun).

Yoshinari was victorious in the opening engagement of the war, which was fought on October 25, and in the battle that occurred on October 29 he routed the forces of Kageakira ASAKURA and continued fighting against both the forces of Yoshiie YAMAZAKI and Kosaburo AHAKA, who were allied with the Asakura clan, and against Asai clan allies like Genba ASAI and the Hatamoto (direct shogunal vassal) Nagamasa ASAI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました

sen.j: この合戦の最中に討ち死。
sen.e: Yoshinari was killed in this battle.
Yoshinari was killed in this battle.
Yoshinari was killed during the battle.
